properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.access-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Access Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.amazon-a-w-s-host
properties.description: The hostname of the Amazon AWS cloud.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.amazon-s-q-s-client
properties.description: To use the AmazonSQS as client. The option is a software.amazon.awssdk.services.sqs.SqsClient type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.attribute-names
properties.description: A list of attribute names to receive when consuming. Multiple names can be separated by comma.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.auto-create-queue
properties.description: Setting the autocreation of the queue

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.batch-separator
properties.description: Set the separator when passing a String to send batch message operation

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.concurrent-consumers
properties.description: Allows you to use multiple threads to poll the sqs queue to increase throughput

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.configuration
properties.description: The AWS SQS default configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.aws2.sqs.Sqs2Configuration type.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.default-visibility-timeout
properties.description: The default visibility timeout (in seconds)

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.delay-queue
properties.description: Define if you want to apply delaySeconds option to the queue or on single messages

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.delay-seconds
properties.description: Delay sending messages for a number of seconds.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.delete-after-read
properties.description: Delete message from SQS after it has been read

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.delete-if-filtered
properties.description: Whether or not to send the DeleteMessage to the SQS queue if the exchange has property with key Sqs2Constants#SQS_DELETE_FILTERED (CamelAwsSqsDeleteFiltered) set to true.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the aws2-sqs component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.extend-message-visibility
properties.description: If enabled then a scheduled background task will keep extending the message visibility on SQS. This is needed if it takes a long time to process the message. If set to true defaultVisibilityTimeout must be set. See details at Amazon docs.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.kms-data-key-reuse-period-seconds
properties.description: The length of time, in seconds, for which Amazon SQS can reuse a data key to encrypt or decrypt messages before calling AWS KMS again. An integer representing seconds, between 60 seconds (1 minute) and 86,400 seconds (24 hours). Default: 300 (5 minutes).

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.kms-master-key-id
properties.description: The ID of an AWS-managed customer master key (CMK) for Amazon SQS or a custom CMK.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.maximum-message-size
properties.description: The maximumMessageSize (in bytes) an SQS message can contain for this queue.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.message-attribute-names
properties.description: A list of message attribute names to receive when consuming. Multiple names can be separated by comma.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.message-deduplication-id-strategy
properties.description: Only for FIFO queues. Strategy for setting the messageDeduplicationId on the message. Can be one of the following options: useExchangeId, useContentBasedDeduplication. For the useContentBasedDeduplication option, no messageDeduplicationId will be set on the message.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.message-group-id-strategy
properties.description: Only for FIFO queues. Strategy for setting the messageGroupId on the message. Can be one of the following options: useConstant, useExchangeId, usePropertyValue. For the usePropertyValue option, the value of property CamelAwsMessageGroupId will be used.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.message-header-exceeded-limit
properties.description: What to do if sending to AWS SQS has more messages than AWS allows (currently only maximum 10 message headers is allowed). WARN will log a WARN about the limit is for each additional header, so the message can be sent to AWS. WARN_ONCE will only log one time a WARN about the limit is hit, and drop additional headers, so the message can be sent to AWS. IGNORE will ignore (no logging) and drop additional headers, so the message can be sent to AWS. FAIL will cause an exception to be thrown and the message is not sent to AWS.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.message-retention-period
properties.description: The messageRetentionPeriod (in seconds) a message will be retained by SQS for this queue.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.operation
properties.description: The operation to do in case the user don't want to send only a message

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.override-endpoint
properties.description: Set the need for overriding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with uriEndpointOverride option

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.policy
properties.description: The policy for this queue. It can be loaded by default from classpath, but you can prefix with classpath:, file:, or http: to load the resource from different systems.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.protocol
properties.description: The underlying protocol used to communicate with SQS

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.proxy-host
properties.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the SQS client

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.proxy-port
properties.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the SQS client

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.proxy-protocol
properties.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the SQS client

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.queue-owner-a-w-s-account-id
properties.description: Specify the queue owner aws account id when you need to connect the queue with different account owner.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.queue-url
properties.description: To define the queueUrl explicitly. All other parameters, which would influence the queueUrl, are ignored. This parameter is intended to be used, to connect to a mock implementation of SQS, for testing purposes.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.receive-message-wait-time-seconds
properties.description: If you do not specify WaitTimeSeconds in the request, the queue attribute ReceiveMessageWaitTimeSeconds is used to determine how long to wait.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.redrive-policy
properties.description: Specify the policy that send message to DeadLetter queue. See detail at Amazon docs.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.region
properties.description: The region in which SQS client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.secret-key
properties.description: Amazon AWS Secret Key

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.server-side-encryption-enabled
properties.description: Define if Server Side Encryption is enabled or not on the queue

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.trust-all-certificates
properties.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.uri-endpoint-override
properties.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.use-default-credentials-provider
properties.description: Set whether the SQS client should expect to load credentials on an AWS infra instance or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.visibility-timeout
properties.description: The duration (in seconds) that the received messages are hidden from subsequent retrieve requests after being retrieved by a ReceiveMessage request to set in the com.amazonaws.services.sqs.model.SetQueueAttributesRequest. This only make sense if its different from defaultVisibilityTimeout. It changes the queue visibility timeout attribute permanently.

properties.name: camel.component.aws2-sqs.wait-time-seconds
properties.description: Duration in seconds (0 to 20) that the ReceiveMessage action call will wait until a message is in the queue to include in the response.
